result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Ray Chrislaw Jr.

records.addlTxt: Initial Scheduling Order
Calendar call on February 22, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Activity: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

8:40 AM Defendant Joseph Ray Chrislaw Jr. appeared by phone.  Attorney Ryan W O'Hara appeared by video for Joseph Ray Chrislaw Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Parties stipulate to identification of defendant appearing by phone only, defendant had zoom issues trying to appear by video. Officer Alexander Limberg of the Beloit Police Department sworn testimony taken by video. State moves for bind over, defense objects. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set. Bond to continue.
Preliminary hearing on October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No violent or disorderly contact with B.M.S or minor child. No discussion of case. Maintain absolute sobriety.

8:57 AM Defendant Joseph Ray Chrislaw Jr. appeared by video.  Attorney Ryan W O'Hara appeared by video for Joseph Ray Chrislaw Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Richard Jay Sullivan appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Witness unavailable. State requests continuance, Defense does not object. Parties argue bond. Court modifies bond conditions: No contact violent or disorderly contact with victim B.M.S. or minor child. No discussion of case. Maintain absolute sobriety. Must sign bond by end of day October 1, 2022.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 23, 2022 at 08:45 am.

9:01 AM Defendant Joseph Ray Chrislaw Jr. appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Ryan W O'Hara appeared by video for Joseph Ray Chrislaw Jr.  Attorney Richard Jay Sullivan appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Witness unavailable. State requests continuance, no objection from Defense. Court finds good cause to extend time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Pro Se Bond Motion
Preliminary hearing on September 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

No contact directly or indirectly with victim B.M.S., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere except may talk or text, except about this case. Maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with the minor shared child unless family court commissioner or judge orders contact.

3:28 PM  Defendant Joseph Ray Chrislaw Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ryan W O'Hara appeared by video for Joseph Ray Chrislaw Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Mason C Braunschweig appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Victim B.S. by video.  Complaint copy to attorney.  Reading waived.  Preliminary hearing requested by zoom within time limits.  Court modifies bond condition as to victim B.S. to allow verbal or text contact but may not discuss case.  No contact remains with minor child.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Waiver of No Contact Provision of Bond - BS
Waiver of No Contact Provision of Bond - BS

records.addlTxt: Ryan O'Hara
A victim in this matter has requested to be notified of all proceedings.
Pro Se Bond Motion

03:21 PM Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joseph Ray Chrislaw Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Anna Elizabeth Hartz appeared by video for Joseph Ray Chrislaw Jr. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Cash bond of $1000 set with conditions of no contact directly or indirectly with victim B.M.S., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with the minor shared child unless family court commissioner or judge orders contact. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 3:00pm.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report

No contact directly or indirectly with victim B.M.S., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with the minor shared child unless family court commissioner or judge orders contact.
